nodes.bodyText:
See original version 
  
    
      crate/server/src/test/java/io/crate/integrationtests/GroupByAggregateTest.java
    
    
         Line 672
      in
      8ad9ecf
    
    
    
    

        
          
           expectedException.expectMessage("Cannot GROUP BY type: undefined");

The error that is raised:
Caused by: SQLActionException: 400 Bad Request 4000 SQLParseException: Couldn't create executionContexts from
NodeOperations: [1=>NodeOp{ phase{id=1/distributed merge, nodes=[lRtAi887SCSp47-zAA2w-Q], dist=BROADCAST}, downstreamNodes=[pL8El7-xRqeJ54t7h40GKw], downstreamPhase=2, downstreamInputId=0}, 0=>NodeOp{ phase{id=0/collect, nodes=[lRtAi887SCSp47-zAA2w-Q], dist=MODULO}, downstreamNodes=[lRtAi887SCSp47-zAA2w-Q], downstreamPhase=1, downstreamInputId=0}]
Leafs: []
target-sources: [2=>[1], 1=>[0]]
original-error: UnsupportedOperationException: Cannot GROUP BY type: undefined

Is not an error that the user should ever see, as it points to a illegal execution plan.
Although this change here is okay to fix the flakyness, I think we need to follow up here and also fix the error handling internally.
I created a ticket for that in the board.
So i think the error message should point out that it is impossible to group by the non-existing column details_ignored['lol'] . Currently we get a type error (undefined) which is not ideal.
